How should the semester break be spent?
We asked education expert-student coach Murat Aydın how students can make use of the mid-term break.
Mid-term holiday is not only sleeping, having fun, watching TV and spending time on computer for the students.
The mid-term break is an excellent opportunity to prepare for the new term and to review the past one.
The semester break, labeled as ‘spare time’ is also an important opportunity for personal development, gaining knowledge, skills and hobbies.
Make a list of the mid-semester assessment.
Write about and put into practice everything you are going to do and plan.
Be sure that you will have fun and a very productive semester.
Now, let's talk about how a productive semester should be for university students who are currently preparing for YGS and LYS.
Because the questions we receive most from the students preparing for the YGS-LYS exams are about how to prepare for the exams. Should we solve a lot of questions or should we fix our weak spots?
To answer these questions, and to have a productive period, let's first start with some tips for friends preparing for the exam.

The preparation process for the exam should normally start from the 9th grade, but we try to complete it mostly in the last year, which forces us to finish the last year more effectively, efficiently and to use our time more efficiently.
The last grade student has to carry out the school written work along with the exam prep.
The year that a student who has graduated from high school prepares to take the exam again has critical importance to him, even if he has taken the exam at least once.
This is because most graduates and families perceive the year of 'O' as the last chance, which creates even more stress.

Studying for class is the type of work that students usually do only when they have to, and they usually leave it to the last minute because they do not enjoy it, but for students who make it a regular practice and turn it into a habit, it becomes more of a duty and it is always part of a plan about what needs to be done and when it needs to be done.
Now we have a half-term holiday in front of us and we should make the best of it.
In order to do this, we must have a plan that lets us manage our time well.
Studying During the Mid-Year Holiday:
Everyone should make a plan suitable for his own situation in the first place.
List what is done in the first term and what is missing; plan the day, the week and the 15-day period.
Both subject reviews and solution reviews of the exam questions must be prepared during this period.
Also, the students who do not miss many classes can solve one or two practice tests.
Fix Your Weaknesses: Studies show that people forget 75 percent of what they learn within a week, 66 percent within a day and 54 percent within an hour.
The best and most effective way to eliminate forgetting is to repeat the task.
Especially students who make a lot of mistakes from the past topics should focus on general review exercises.
First, determine and prioritize your missing topics, and plan them day by day. Add topics to each day and make sure you do them.
This planning will calm you down both academically and psychologically.
When scheduling your test, make sure that the subjects that you make most mistakes in are scheduled at the beginning.
Because you will not have such a long holiday period in the future.
Make Question Solutions:
It is as important to solve questions as it is to review.
Because we can only understand how well we understand our work through the feedback we receive through the questions we answer.
Do not forget to set a certain number of problem solutions each day.

The number of questions you solve may vary depending on the studies you do that day; you may not be able to solve a lot of questions on a heavy-content day, but we should still do at least some practice of solving questions to see how much we have learned that day.
Do the Practice Test.
Another thing to do during your winter break is to solve the test exams.
Although not all of the topics are finished, at least you can solve the exams and the test questions.
Let's say you have a pretty good handle on Turkish; you can solve 40-question Turkish practice exams.
And do time yourself while you do it.
If you can solve 40 Turkish questions in 60 minutes in the first place, then your next goal, if possible, should be to solve them in a few minutes less.
Holiday and hobby planning:
Of course, holidays is not just about studying, you should allocate a few days for holiday, relaxation, and your hobbies.
Spending a holiday period only studying will prevent you from decharging and relaxing.
Because of this, you must make time for yourself.
Reading books, watching TV and surfing the internet might all be on your list of plans, but the most important thing is how much time you are going to spend on each of them.
I also have a small advise for friends who say that they did not spend their first period efficiently.
If you say 'my first semester didn't go too well, I couldn't work much and I have too many deficiencies', the mid-term break is a great opportunity for you.
But first, you must decide that and believe that.
In the Turkish Super League in the 2009-2010 season, goals were scored most between the 76th and 90th minutes.
Now answer the question you asked yourself. Is the match over and you are going to the locker room or is the match still going on and you have many minutes to score a goal?
I think nobody wants to hear the classic statement of a coach or a footballer of a defeated football team, namely "we need to look ahead to the next games"
Now the only thing you should do is to stop looking back and start running instead of walking.
To sum up what we've said:
First of all, plan a semester break,
2) Review by going over the topics that you know.
Take care of any unfinished business.

Set new goals for the new era.

FedEx reported disappointing results for the past three months and the cargo giant lowered its full-year profit outlook due to a decline in demand for cargo services and higher costs at ground operations.
The company also said it was planning to hire about 55,000 seasonal workers for the holidays.

About 2.5 percent was dropped in the pre-opening procedures before the opening gong on Wednesday.

Analysts, based on a survey by FactSet, were expecting 10.84 $.
Despite an average 4.9% increase that will take effect on January 4th and higher surcharges on heavy or large packages that will start in November, there is a possibility of a decrease.
According to the corporation, the profits are still expected to be high compared to the previous year because of cost cuts, higher income and the growth of e-commerce.

The company's president and CEO, Fred Smith, said that the company has "shown solid performance in spite of the weaker than expected economic conditions, especially in manufacturing and global trade."
The holiday hiring plans were disclosed a day later by rival UPS, which said it planned to hire 90,000 to 95,000 seasonal employees, the same number it hired last year.
In the three-month period ending August 31, FedEx's revenue increased 6 percent to $692 million.
Earnings per share came in at $2.42, missing Zacks Investment Research's surveyed consensus estimate of $2.44 by $0.02.
The income increased 5 percent to 12.3 billion dollars.
Six analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $12.23 billion.
FedEx took a hit from a slowdown in international priority shipping last year, which caused revenues to stagnate in its Express unit.
But the explosion of online shopping helped boost the results of FedEx's Ground Delivery Service.
In the fourth quarter, land services revenue grew by 29 percent, but operating income was generally stagnant due to high costs in big packages and internal insurance.
As the income decreased in the cargo section due to high labor cost, the express unit saw high income because of high base rates.

At their most anticipated meeting of the year, Federal Reserve policy makers spent two days around a 27-foot Honduras mahogany table this week debating whether the time has finally come to raise interest rates for the first time in nearly a decade.
Two-story conference room on one flank of the central bank will be decorated with a mural of the United States.
A reminder that the Federal Reserve's chairwoman, Janet L. Yellen, and her colleagues put the nation's economic well-being above anything else.
The central bank has two mandates from Congress: to keep American employment at maximum level and to keep prices here stable.
But since the Great Depression, Fed leaders have agreed to a third, unwritten mandate: financial balance.

And the third proxy, a decision that will be announced on Thursday and that could be the X factor in an almost unforeseeable verdict on whether the U.S. economy is ready to begin weaning itself off the unprecedented stimulus provided by near-zero short-term interest rates since the end of 2008.

While most of the data point to a solid expansion in the data economy, the recent volatility in global financial markets could make Fed officials who were already cautious about adding fragility, by raising the federal funds rate, even more jittery than they were - even by a quarter of a percent.
"It's going to be the labor market and inflation that they're going to be watching first and foremost," said Lindsey M. Piegza, chief economist at brokerage firm Stifel Nicolaus & Co.
"But if they are looking for an excuse not to raise the rate, the increased uncertainty surrounding the global economy provides them with enough justification to wait a little longer," he said.
There is no agreement on what the Fed will do and that is creating some volatility in the financial markets themselves.
Recently, half of the economists that Bloomberg spoke with were expecting a rate hike this week.
Meanwhile, the financial markets are expecting the Fed to wait with its main indicator showing only a roughly 30 percent chance of a hike.
This could point to a decline in the equities market if the policy makers do not dampen the effect by giving speeches that another hike is on the way should the Fed raise rates.
On Tuesday, the Dow Jones industrial average rose 228.89 points or 1.4% to 16,599.85.
John Lonski, chief economist of Moody's Capital Markets Research Group, said, "The rise was triggered by expectations that Fed policymakers will keep rates on hold this week."
"It would be surprising if the Fed raised rates now," she said.
Had the Fed officials made such a decision, they would have had to take a long year to calm the financial markets, to keep them from panicking.
Other experts argue that the financial markets would be steadied by an increase in the rate, which would lift the curtain of uncertainty about when the Fed will move.

Only a month ago the Fed looked as if it was on track to raise rates by a quarter of a percentage point this month, a modest step that would tighten monetary conditions, and strengthen America’s recovery.
Yellen, despite complaints from liberals about the need for a more economic process, said she expected the rate increase in the spring and at the beginning of summer.
The pace of job creation may have slowed down in August, but the growth in the labor market this year has been steady.
Unemployment rate dropped to 5.1 percent, its lowest in seven years, and approached the full-employment level that the Fed considers.
Salary increases showed signs of improvement.
And despite inflation staying below the Fed's annual target of 2%, policy makers said the sharp drop in oil prices is a significant reason for the recent low readings.
Ian Shepherdson, chief economist at Pantheon Macroeconomics, said the economy "can cope with higher rates and needs them, despite the tightness in the labor market."
But all the financial markets in the world have begun to be shaken after China's currency, the yuan, was devalued at the end of last month.
The Dow Jones industrial average fell more than 16 percent below its May record high because of the fear that investors had that a slowing Chinese economy would drag down global growth.
The market, down almost 10 percent from the Dow's May highs, somehow bounced back.
The market turbulence makes it even more difficult for Fed policymakers to figure out when to raise the interest rate.

Stephen D. Oliner, senior research fellow at the UCLA Ziman Center for Real Estate and former Fed staffer, said that "they could have been a little bit more narrowed in this meeting, given the unknown here in the Chinese financial markets in the last few weeks and the lack of news on the economy softening."
They now think it will take at least another month to better manage these effects.
"There's a lot of uncertainty about what's going to happen in the US economy and they have almost no data on which to hang their hopes that things are going to get better in China," Oliner said.
The health of the global economy is not one of the Federal Reserve's top concerns, which means it should not be a factor in the black-out process technically.
But in reality, it has become the world's economic authority.
The effect of the central bank has been great in recent years.
Until then, the only clue from President Ben S. Bernanke was that Fed may "taper" its global market-rattling monetary easing in 2013.

In a world in which markets and economies have become increasingly intertwined, the Fed officials cannot only follow the developments in other places, but they may also consult with other central bankers and experts to better understand the global economy.
Zachary Karabell, the chief global strategist at asset management firm Envestnet Inc., said the decision-making process is "more art than science."

Jeffrey Lacker, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond, Va., noted this month that the Fed has "overreacted in the past to financial market movements that were not connected to economic fundamentals."
Lacker, who is a voting member of the policy-making Federal Open Market Committee, and who has been pushing for a rate increase, cited the 1998-99 decisions as an example.
Lacker said, "Despite the limited guidance for US growth, the Asian financial crisis led the Fed to cut rates by three quarters of a point over the course of three meetings.

A year later, Fed officials reversed the cuts.
"""

Adam S. Posen, who used to be a member of the UK Central Bank's interest-rate-setting committee, said "The Fed should only focus on financial balance concerns during the large crises, just as it did in the 2008 market meltdown."
The last one was not at this level, he said.
You really don't want to take the risk of being seen as going too far, because the markets are grumpy, said Posen, president of the Peterson Institute for International Economics.
The Central Bank Law still has two authorities and does not talk about financial balance and until that changes, I do not think that we should take any action in that direction.
Do you want a great Thailand market?
Try LAX-C in the Chinatown.
Yes, Chinatown.
The market/warehouse opened in 1997, and it belongs to LAX-C Ltd.
LAX-C is a wholesale Thai market that also sells to the public, sometimes referred to as the Thai Costco.
Yes, that is China Town, not the Taiwan Town.
The market/warehouse is a single-stop shop for a wide variety of fresh, frozen, and dried foods, popular Asian and Thai snacks, kitchenware, furniture, religious and holiday decorations.
If you want to buy some engine oil, there is also a car section.
The store is massive and walking through all the aisles could take an hour.
If you get hungry during all this shopping, grab a bite to eat from LAX-C BBQ Express.
The interior food section (good, inexpensive) is next to the check-out, and there are various takeout options.
What do they stock: Are you looking for something Thai?
She's probably at LAX-C.
The products are reasonably priced and some are sold in bulk.

Among the fresh produce you'll find special Asian and regional Thai herbs, fruits and more.
## Word order
The meat counter is extensive, so is the fish - the people working behind the counter clean the fish, filet it, and if you want, they can fry it for you.

There is a large frozen food section in most of the store; there you can find frozen curry leaves, hot gourd, and galangal, whole duck, fish, beef blood, fish balls, regional sausages, commercial food items and more.
Who shops there: Restaurant owners and chefs, families, and individuals.
There are both shopping carts and forklifts in the wide corridors.
Fresh monthong durian is available at the exit of the stand.
Where: Between Chinatown and downtown, in Los Angeles' industrial district, a few blocks from Philippe The Original.
Parking: LAX-C has its own parking spots, which it shares with other stores and restaurants.
Although the mall is very crowded, it's usually not difficult to find a parking spot.
Brazil's Rio Grande Pediatric Society promotes healthy nutrition during breastfeeding

A Brazilian pediatric organization, SPRS, shocked viewers by taking a controversial approach to educate women about the importance of healthy eating during the breastfeeding process and to encourage them to try it out, with pictures of milk-fed babies that were painted with unhealthy food depictions.
Human milk is made up of many types of proteins, fats, vitamins and carbohydrates which supply the baby with the necessary nutrition to develop a healthy immune system.
It is recommended that pregnant women and new mothers increase their daily calorie intake by about 500 calories due to their energy surplus needs.
But according to new research, the food supplements that mothers need are not just limited to calorie intake.

A new study by Robert Waterland, Professor of Pediatrics-Nutrition at Baylor College of Medicine, suggests that a healthy diet during pregnancy can protect babies by influencing the expression of their genes, shielding them from cancer development.
Unfortunately it has been determined that unhealthy diet affects the child's immune system in a negative way.

Four people, including a four-year-old boy, were killed when police opened fire with plastic bullets on a crowd of demonstrators protesting against the draft constitution proposed for the country, an official said Wednesday.
The incident took place Tuesday evening in Rupandehi, 175 miles (280 kilometers) west of the capital, Katmandu.
District chief Bishnu Prasad Dhakal said more than 1000 protesters had gathered outside a police station and some had thrown stones and petrol bombs.
Mr. Dhakal said the police had fired tear gas into the air and shot into the air before using the plastic bullets.
He said that twenty police officers and five civilians were injured.
It is not clear why the plastic bullets, which are known to kill but which are used because they are normally a less fatal alternative, should have ended in such a high death rate.

The conflict is the latest in a series of violent protests that have swept the southern plains of Nepal for weeks, where members of the Madhesi ethnic group say the regions created by the proposed constitution will dilute their political influence.
The Tharu ethnic group, which wants its own state in western Nepal, is also staging protests.
At least 40 people, including 11 police officers, have been killed since August 10th in violent clashes.

On that day the four main political parties had agreed on a deal to carve the country into regions - a significant but potentially divisive move in Nepal, governed by a central state for centuries, which is preparing a new constitution.
Work on a new constitution has been going on since 2008, but lawmakers accelerated the process after the devastating earthquake in April which killed thousands of people.
Lawmakers in Katmandu worked this week on a draft of the constitution, and officials said the new text will be ready by Sunday.
NHC says there is 60 percent chance of a hurricane forming near the Cape Verde Islands.

The US National Hurricane Center said on Tuesday that there was a 60 percent chance that a broad low-pressure system about 350 miles (560 km) south of the southernmost Cape Verde Islands would develop into a tropical storm within 48 hours.

Another well-defined low pressure system was seen between the Cape Verde Islands and the Leeward Islands, and the Miami-based weather forecast center said the chances of a tropical storm forming within the next two days was 60%.
Google started a matching donation campaign to raise 11 million dollars for refugees.

Google Inc (GOOGL.O) announced a donation-matching campaign aimed at raising $11 million for humanitarian organizations helping thousands of refugees who have fled war-torn and impoverished countries to Europe.
Google announced its donation effort in its blog with a personal approach that was unexpected from it.
Instead of an executive making this declaration, Rita Masoud, a Google employee who escaped with her family from Kabul when she was seven, wrote about her own personal experience.
He wrote, "Along with hunger, thirst, cold, and fear, there were dark bus and train rides."
I was lucky.
But with the refugee and migrant crisis growing in Europe, many families like mine are in need of assistance.

The donations will go to four non-governmental organizations that assist refugees and migrants: Doctors Without Borders, the International Rescue Committee, Save the Children and the UNHCR, the U.N. refugee agency.
Google said it will match donations on the first $5.5 million, up to $11 million, at google.com/refugeerelief.

Europe is facing its worst refugee crisis since World War II, and the main reason is the civil war in Syria, which has been lasting for four years and has displaced more than four million people this year.
Many refugees are also fleeing war-torn Afghanistan, Yemen, Iraq and Libya.
By Yasmeen Abutaleb; Edited By Christian Plumb
Bariatric surgery may be helpful for diabetes patients who are moderately obese
New research shows that it may take at least five years to see the benefits of bariatric surgery in moderate to severely obese people with type 2 diabetes.
It is too early to say whether diabetes patients with moderate obesity will live longer than those who didn't get surgical treatment after obesity surgery.
According to Dr Robin Blackstone, who authored an article on the new study on JAMA surgery, "it takes a long time for death rates to show up."
Weight-loss surgeries, also known as bariatric surgery, use a variety of methods to reduce stomach size.
These suppress hunger and restrict the body's ability to digest food.

Over the years, it has been established that bariatric surgery is effective in treating type 2 diabetes, but most of the studies have been done on people who are morbidly obese with a body mass index (BMI) of 35 or higher.
BMI, which is measured based on the proportion of height and weight, is considered normal if it is between 18.5 and 24.9.
A BMI of 25 or more indicates being overweight, while a BMI of 30 or over indicates being obese.
You can calculate your BMI from the following link: 1.usa.gov/1D0ZqDv.

The new study, at Taiwan's fully-equipped Min-Sheng Hospital, used the data from a trial that compared two types of bariatric surgery used in the treatment of moderate-obese patients with type 2 diabetes since 2007.
By the end of fifth year, the average BMI of the surgical group dropped from 31 to 24.5.
In contrast, the BMI of those receiving non-surgical diabetes treatment remained at around 29.
Diabetes is completely solved in 36% and partially solved in 28% of those who have undergone surgery.
A total of 1% of the patients receiving treatment and 2% of the patients receiving partial treatment have been able to cure their diabetes.
Also, as the writers indicated, blood pressure control, triglycerides and "bad" LDL cholesterol, were generally better in the "surgically treated group."
The scientists have also examined the levels of the A1c hemoglobin, which shows the blood sugar levels over time, in the patients.
According to the researchers, it is best to keep A1c hemoglobin below 7%.
The average A1c post-surgery hemoglobin dropped from nine to six percent.
The rate has remained at around 8% in the group that received medical treatment.
But, improved A1c hemoglobin levels, or better "glycemic control," were not associated with reduced mortality over five years, according to Dr. Chih-Cheng Hsu and colleagues who conducted the study.
The research team compared the findings to the two types of surgery.

By the fifth year, the group of patients who had undergone bypass surgery lost more weight compared to the Roux-en-Y group (18.7 vs. 14.2 kg), had a higher decrease in BMI (7.4 vs. 5.1), and also in HbA1c (3.1 vs. 2.1%), and their chances of complete remission of diabetes were higher (46.9% vs. 16.7%).

While the research showed no clear benefit for survival after five years, Dr. Blackstone of Arizona College of Medicine-Phoenix said there is valid data from a study in Sweden in heavier patients that showed an extended life span for those who had surgery.

Swedish researchers in this study report that the risk of death within 15 years was 29 percent lower among obese patients who had bariatric surgery than among those who had been treated with more traditional methods.

Although this latest study does not show what the benefits might be in terms of survival to those who undergo surgery, Blackstone claims that this is reassuring for those who are involved in the subject and whose BMI is under 35.

The most important part of the article is here, because it says that the operation is safe in the group of patients with a low BMI, there is no increase in the risk of death or renal disease, he said.
Blackstone added that people and doctors need to take the issue of weight gain seriously when a patient's BMI falls below 27 and 30.
I think we've waited long enough for people to take this seriously, he said.
I think after collecting all these genetic changes that make their bodies obese and diabetic, it is really hard to reverse it.
"It is impossible for everyone to come to Europe" - Dalai Lama - RT News

There is a four-fold increase in children swallowing hand sanitizer during the last four years.

Poison control centers in the United States have reported nearly a 400 percent increase from 2010 to 2012 in the number of alcohol-containing hand sanitizer ingestions in children under the age of 12.
According to Gaylord Lopez, the director of the Georgia Poison Control Center, the number of child-reported cases of ingesting hand sanitizer has risen from 3,266 in 2010 to 16,117 in 2014.
Lopez told CNN that "kids are more attracted to these types of products and unfortunately there are a percentage of them that need to be removed."
He said that some children drank hand sanitizers knowingly, and some of them said that they did this to impress their friends or to make a social media challenge.
Videos on YouTube show teenagers drinking antiseptic for cheap intoxication.
Some teenagers are reported to mix the antiseptic mixture with mouthwashes that contain alcohol in order to get a stronger hit.
Small children could be drawn to the attractive smell of antiseptics.
Lopez said, "The child doesn't think it is a bad thing."
The most attractive ones are the scented ones.
Hand sanitizers with strawberry, grape and orange scents are available to appeal to children.
Hand sanitizers contain from 45 to 95 percent alcohol, whichever way you look at it.
Especially in small children, just a few gulps can cause alcohol poisoning.
According to Dr. Stephen Thornton, who heads the University of Kansas Hospital's Poison Control Center, "it's highly concentrated alcohol."
We do not leave a few whiskey glasses around but people do leave these hand antiseptics around and it is an easy way for children to get a lot of alcohol.
Recently, six-year-old Nhaijah Russell was airlifted to hospital for treatment after swallowing only four squirts of strawberry-scented hand sanitizer at her school.
Her alcohol level was 0.179, which is twice the legal limit for an adult, according to emergency room doctor Dr. Chris Richey, who treated her at Gwinnett Medical Center, just outside Atlanta.
Nhaijah could not speak or walk when he came to the emergency room.

According to Rithey, the doctors kept the little girl under observation in a separate children's hospital overnight, despite the fact that doctors could not find any signs of a brain trauma. She fell and hit her head because of the alcohol.
"It was very frightening," said mother Ortoria Scott to CNN.
It could have been fatal for my child.
Lopez recommends parents and teachers use alcohol-free products or keep their contact with the skin short, and store them in places children cannot reach.
Besides alcohol poisoning, some antiseptics have been linked to death cases.
In 2013, two women from Ontario died from ingesting hand sanitizer that contained an unnamed toxic substance.
Health officials have suggested that the substance, which was registered on the label as ethyl alcohol, could actually be methanol, which has a potentially fatal effect.
In January, three fourth-graders from upstate New York were plotting, according to police reports, to poison their "evil" teacher by "setting up an antibacterial product around the classroom."
Because the teacher is extremely allergic to hand disinfectants, he has forbidden them to be used in the classroom.
The police characterized this plan as a "futile attempt", and recommended a disciplinary punishment for the school administration.

Saudi Arabia did not give up on TÜBİTAK

Science, Industry, and Technology Minister Fikri Işık stated that a new agreement was made for the second sale of the Ballistics Image Analysis and Recognition System (BALISTIKA), which was developed by TÜBİTAK, to Saudi Arabia, saying, "With the agreement, which includes the development and installation of an additional 8 systems, the number of BALISTIKA systems serving in Saudi Arabia will increase to 14 from 6."
Işık gave a briefing about the project BALİSTİKA, which was developed by TÜBİTAK Space Technologies Research Institute.

Işık explains that the system enables ballistic examinations of guns, bullet cores, and casings that are seized in incidents to be compared with data in the central data base, and states that in this way, problems that ballistic experts encounter when examining casings and bullet cores are eliminated.
Işık said that the different data from the geographic locations and the accompanying information were stored and queried together thanks to BALLISTICS.

Noting that one of the main features of the BALISTIKA system is the ability to obtain and display three-dimensional data with more details and less error, Işık stated that the innovations introduced by the system make it possible to make the final decisions by ballistic experts quickly and that the success rate has increased significantly.
The BALISTICA was exported under the SUBA-1 Project.

Stating that BALISTIKA has met all the criteria in the success criteria and has received full marks from the General Directorate of Security, Işık also noted that the system, established in 10 different regions including Ankara, covers all of Turkey.

Indicating that the success of the system resulted in opening up to the foreign countries, ışık, remembered that BALISTIKA was exported within the scope of "SUBA-1 Project" carried out with Saudi Arabia and the installation was successfully completed in 6 zones in 2013.

Işık said that a new agreement was signed for the second party sale of the BALISTICA to Saudi Arabia, and the agreement, which covers the development and installation of 8 additional systems, will increase the number of BALISTICAs serving in Saudi Arabia from 6 to 14.
A crocodile fossil the size of a bus was found.
The prehistoric marine reptile was reported to have been 10 meters long and to have weighed 3 tons.
Only the length of the crocodile's skull was measured as 1.6 meters.
The researchers named the species "Machimosaurus rex" and published their findings in the journal Cretaceous Research.
The lead author of the paper, Federico Fanti, from the University of Bologna said that the fossil, estimated to be 130 million years old, was "almost the size of a bus."
Fanti told Washington Post that the gigantic saltwater crocodile "would have been at the top of the food chain in at least one region during that period."
Paleontologists revealed that M. rex, which is thought to be the largest crocodile that lived in the sea, was hunting by lying in wait in lagoons.

The largest freshwater crocodile in history, scientists believe, is Sarcosuchus imperator, which lived in Africa and South America 110 million years ago and reached a length of 12 meters and a weight of 8 tons.

S/he leaves a letter

"Consume kefir, live long."
Can be consumed at every age safely.

Pınar Kural Enç, a specialist dietician, points out that kefir, with milk as its main ingredient and which is more beneficial than milk, is one of the foods which can be consumed safely by people of all ages, "It is more nutritious than yogurt, because it contains protein, basic minerals and B vitamins."

It forms the basis of a healthy nervous system, thanks to its calcium and magnesium content.

Kefir not only satisfies hunger but also does not make you gain weight.
"It's a very nutritious drink, and it's easy to digest", he said.
All-purpose remedy
Dietician Pınar Kural Enç says that children, the elderly, pregnant women and those menopausal can drink kefir without hesitation, and she says that kefir is basically a local drink from Caucasus.

The secret to youth, kefir, a healthy and long-life elixir, is the remedy for almost any disease.
Kefir is one of the most natural ways to keep babies away from metabolic diseases.
Friend of the intestines
This unique drink, the benefits of which cannot be enumerated, is friend of the intestines.
There are 1.5-2 kilograms of bacteria and fungi in our intestines.
Microorganisms in the digestive system are also divided into two groups as beneficial and harmful.
Beneficial microorganisms are called 'probiotic microorganisms'.

The activities of the probiotics have as much importance as our liver, and when they are consumed in adequate amounts, they prevent the harmful microorganisms in the intestines from sticking to the intestines wall and spreading.
An imbalance in the healthy microorganisms in the intestines can lead to many diseases.
The digestive tract should be kept healthy with the right dietary habits.
For this, we have to consume probiotics in sufficient amounts.
It eliminates these problems in the intestines.
Kefir is a food rich with probiotic bacteria, the most effective ones, and the beneficial bacteria in it has a tremendous effect on strengthening the intestinal system.
It enables the beneficial bacteria and fungi in the intestines to multiply and be beneficial in a healthy manner.
Regular kefir use makes the intestines work, removes intestinal disorders, reduces bloating, and provides a healthier digestion.
A healthy digestive system means a healthy and disease-free body.

Consumer confidence in the USA at a 7-month high.
According to the University data, UMICH rose by 0.7 points and became 93.3 in January compared to the end of December.
With this result, the market expectation for the index, which marked its highest level since June 2015, was determined as 92.9.

In a written statement, Richard Curtin, the director of the University of Michigan Consumer Surveys, said, "Consumer confidence extended its gains into a fourth month due to improving perceptions of future economic growth."
He made the evaluation: "Individual financial expectations also generally held their highest level since 2007, due to the weakness in inflation."
The statement also contains a prediction that consumer optimism will continue to depend on inflation staying at extraordinarily low levels.
With an average of 92.9, UMICH recorded its best annual performance last year since 2004. It is determined based on the results of a 50-question survey conducted with at least 500 people each month.

Putin is eating his own shit.

While Russia is preparing to grant Turkish companies "a status of doing business with Russia" if Russia cannot provide services in any other way, Russian Association of Tour Operators has announced that Russian citizens are not giving up on Turkey.

The Russian Ministry of Economic Development, which calculates that severing economic ties with Turkey would cost Russia extra money, has prepared a new "State of emergency" bill on Turkey and published it.

In the draft published in the Russian Federal Register, the permission for Turkish firms and companies to do business with Russia is envisaged, even if they enter the area of sanctions when necessary.
According to the draft, Turkish companies and firms will be able to benefit from their products and services when it is impossible or costly to secure them from sources other than Turkey.

Which Turkish products and services will be included in this category will be determined by a joint commission to be set up under the Russian Ministry of Economic Development and other related ministries.
So the bureaucrats will be able to decide and settle which Turkish companies will be able to work with Russia.

According to the same document, the Russian state-owned organizations and private companies will have to prove to the commission that there is no equal to the business they will do with Turkish partners.
If the draft is approved by the Russian government and goes into effect, then favored Turkish companies will also be registered in Russia.
The Russian Tour Operators Association also said in a statement yesterday that Russian citizens had not given up on Turkey.

In the statement, it was stated: "Despite the travel ban and the recommendation of the Russian Foreign Ministry not to go to Turkey, our citizens have started to look for the formula of organizing their holidays on their own."
There are a large number of articles online under the title 'The most practical and cheapest way to holiday in Turkey.'
The most common recommendation is to make hotel reservations online and to fly with TK.
Russia's Prime Minister Dmitriy Medvedev described the drop in oil prices below thirty dollars as a "dramatic" development for Russia.
Medvedev said that "Nobody could have imagined that oil would drop to $30 level and it was a very bad surprise for our government."
He said, "It looks like it will not be possible to carry out the budget in its present form."
It is the last month of the year 2015 that we have left behind.
After the plane downing incident, Russian President Vladimir Putin announces that the economic sanctions will get even deeper.
In those days, the businessmen of ours who were trying to go to Russia in the accustomed order were suffering in the border gates.
Turkish goods are dragging in the customs, and are being subjected to the unimaginable controls.
Not even a month has passed, and Nerdun Hacıoğlu sends us a message from Moscow yesterday.
Either way, sanctions are softening.
But why?
The reason is very simple.
In an age when the economy is so globalized, the attempt to turn political arguments into economic war by closing the borders with century old methods is not working.
Look, we are still writing news about how the economic embargo that was imposed on Iran for years was circumvented.
Russia and Turkey, two neighboring countries which appear to have many friends but in fact not really, actually depend on each other.
It is technically not possible to separate these two countries, which are mingled with businesspeople, tourists and customers, on such a night.
If you closed the doors, the people of these two countries would enter each others' countries through the chimney.
In order to avoid creating new Reza Zarrabs, the sanctions should be resolved through political discussion at the table.
Without touching the economy...

While unemployment rates in England are rising, the rate has remained the same among the Scots
```
While the number of unemployed remained unchanged at 164,000 in Scotland in the period May-July, the number of unemployed in the UK as a whole increased by 10,000 to 1.82 million.
The unemployment rate in Scotland was higher than in England at 5.9% according to figures from the Office for National Statistics (ONS).
Employment in Scotland, however, fell by 12,000 in the three months to November, leaving 2,612,000 people in work.
Employment in Scotland rates at 74.0 percent, which is higher than the UK average of 73.5 percent.
David Mundell, the Scottish Secretary, commented on the latest figures, saying: “The government’s long term plan is laying the foundations for a stronger economy.”
It has been almost a year since Scotland decided to stay as part of the United Kingdom.

Why I am a witness to an execution in Oklahoma
So today, I'm going to watch a man die, because of a late legal intervention.
I hope it doesn't happen, but if it does, I'll be sitting in the viewing gallery at the Oklahoma State Penitentiary's death chamber as Richard Glossip is executed with a lethal injection.
He wanted me to be one of the four witnesses of his death.
The invitation was first made in January through my best friend and, as shocked as I was, I accepted.
As the day approached, I began to dread it.
So why am I doing this?
I accepted because I thought it was a good way to tell the whole story about the death penalty.
It will offer a unique perspective.
True, journalists are allowed to watch executions in America and there are more to come so that an awful lottery emerges when it comes to deciding who is chosen.
Oklahoma cut its media chairs from 12 to five.
Whoever is elected will be able to watch without falling into emotion.
I can't do this.
I will sit with Richard Glossip's closest friends and, after months of phone calls and a two-and-a-half-hour visit, I have a relationship with him, too.
I love that man.
We laugh a lot when we speak.
The officials in the prison said that I could not be a witness and a journalist at the same time, so they would not give me a pen and a notebook to record what I saw.
I will try to remember all the details.
An Oklahoma reporter accused me on Twitter of compromising my objectivity.
That is the lesson.
Tell the story of the prisoner the way he likes, gain access.
I complained to him.
He agreed that he "could have expressed that better" but still thought that what I did was wrong.
Richard Glossip is not in agreement with me on some of the things I say and write.
He does not tell me what to write, and even if he did, I would not accept it.
I told him that he could remove me from his witness list at any time.
But he does want an international reporter to be there and to write about it.
If he dies, he thinks it will help the anti-death penalty movement.
Huffington Post reporter Kim Bellware will be with me as well.
If you want to find out more about this, please listen to my podcast series.
I will not recount all the details here again.
I am not sure if Richard Glossip is innocent.
What he did after Barry Van Treese's death is enough to make him an accomplice.
However, I still believe that he is innocent of the murder.
I believe there is absolutely no proof that would justify a death sentence.
I think his execution is wrong.
And I'll watch her dying from this perspective.
I cannot claim that I will be completely objective.
You can take a look at the other correspondents there.
The impression you get from me will be the same as the impression you get from a person who sees a man he likes killed for no reason.

Melbourne Storm coach Craig Bellamy hits out at claims that his side is wrestling
Melbourne Storm coach Craig Bellamy has described critical assessments of his team as "agenda setting" in the build-up to the NRL's two favourite premierships.
Sydney Roosters coach Trent Robinson said the referees allowed Storm to "wrestle" with his team during Friday night's semi-final defeat in Sydney.

Brisbane Broncos coach Wayne Bennett, after the team's semi-final win over North Queensland Cowboys on Saturday night, made an allusion to the Melbourne Storm that was far from subtle, calling their match a "cautionary tale" for the rugby league and saying the two Queensland sides were "not very good" at wrestling.
Bellamy defended the team's battle and said they focus only on the "contact" while battling.
Bellamy said he drew strength from the criticism they received from two leading football coaches that they could be beaten by Storm.
This development is continuing. I did not hear Trent Robinson talking about wrestling when we beat them 24-2, Bellamy said on Wednesday.

I can guarantee that we have not changed anything in our defense system or our techniques all year long, but in the last six weeks, we emphasized our tackling in our contact drills, and that has been a turning point for us.
Trent has been there for three years and it's clear that he is coaching a big team and it must be a little shock for him to lose.
It is also funny that this happened at this time of the year.
Bellamy took offense at Bennett's "exciting football" idea, recalling his Dragons coach who had won the 2010 St. George-Illawarra Dragons premiership by playing "boring" football.
Wayne is talking about exciting football.
He compared Saturday night's home game with our Friday night match, and said how exciting the game was.
I remember in 2010, St George was criticised for being dull, and Wayne said he wouldn’t even give his arse to a mouse.
But now they have a team that will play what we could call exciting football and, especially, the young half-backs with their speed.
This is the type of football that you want to play when you have players like that.
He put it on the map in 2010, now everyone wants to play that style of football - there's no team with halves (pairs) like Anthony Milford and Ben Hunt, so it's not possible to play that way.
This gives me more confidence because even they are talking like this because they are a bit scared of playing.
When they went to the big game, they probably didn't think of us six weeks before.
Bellamy also pointed out that the Storm and Roosters match had a higher score than the Broncos and Cowboys match.
The Broncos game was probably a good one, I haven't watched it yet, but what was the score? 16-12?
Is this exciting football? Our score is 20 - 18, our game is more points for both sides.
Or is it more exciting to stop the attacks and not to try for score-getting ones?
That's my agenda.
If they are saying something about us, it means that we will meet them here in the next stage.

Hewlett-Packard will cut 30,000 jobs
Hewlett-Packard plans to lay off between 25,000 and 30,000 employees as part of a restructuring of its corporate services and cost-cutting efforts.
HP will split into two companies in the coming year: one for the slower-growing computer and printer operations, and the other for faster-growing hardware and services operations.
HP said in a statement that the expected layoffs would result in charges of around $2.7 billion in the beginning of its fourth quarter.

Meg Whitman, Chairman and CEO of HP, who will continue as CEO of the new HP Company, said, "These restructuring activities will enable the new Hewlett Packard Company to be more competitive and create a sustainable cost structure."

"Whitman said, "Hewlett Packard Enterprise will be smaller and more focused than HP is today, and will have a rich portfolio of products and services with dedicated R&D investment that will enable it to innovate for the future."
As a separate company, we are in a much better position to satisfy the evolving needs of our customers worldwide.

According to a statement from the company, Hewlett Packard Enterprise will have an annual revenue of more than 50 billion dollars and it will focus on offering "unmatched integrated technology solutions for enterprises."

The garage in Palo Alto, known as "the birthplace of Silicon Valley" and created by Stanford University graduates Bill Hewlett and Dave Packard in the 1930s for making electrical equipment, divides the company.
HP is undergoing a major reorganization to cope with the shift from traditional PCs to mobile devices.
HP's move, one of the lastest in the industry, is a reflection of the belief that leaner companies perform better.

Glencore earned 2.5 billion Dollars from the sale of its shares

Mining giant Glencore, based in Switzerland, was hit by a slump in the prices of processed goods, and on Wednesday, it managed to raise 2.5 billion dollars as part of a debt-division plan by selling its shares.
Glencore, listed in London, announced that it sold new shares worth 1.6 billion pounds to pay off its own debt.
The company, which has shed 57 percent of its market value this year, has been hit hard by falling commodity prices on the back of slowing demand from China and market volatility.
The share price of Glencore rose in early trading on the London Stock Exchange on Wednesday because of the issue of rights.
Shares rose 2.77 percent to 131.60 pence, up 0.69 percent on the FTSE 100 index.
Glencore revealed last week plans to sell $2.5 billion in shares as part of a plan to reduce debt pile by a third to $30 billion.
The company sold the new shares at 125 pence each, which amounts to a 2.4 per cent discount compared to Tuesday's closing price.
The group sold 1.3 billion shares equivalent to 9.99% of the group.
Worry about China's long-standing slowdown has slashed iron ore prices roughly in half, with coal, copper, and other goods falling by 20 to 40 percent.
White House Confirms Xi Jinping's Visit to Washington
The White House confirmed Tuesday that Chinese President Xi Jinping will pay an official visit to the United States at the end of the month.
The statement says that Xi's first official visit to Washington will take place on 25 September and that it will be a reciprocal visit to Barack Obama's visit to Beijing last November.
After the bilateral discussions with the two presidents, President Barack Obama and First Lady Michelle Obama will host an evening meal in honor of Xi and his wife Peng Liyuan.

In the statement, it was also emphasized that "President Xi's visit will broaden U.S.-China cooperation on regional and global issues, in addition to the U.S.-China relationship, and will provide an opportunity for President Obama and President Xi to discuss areas of disagreement in a constructive way."

It is expected that Xi, who announced his visit in February, will first go to Seattle to meet some American tech leaders, and then to New York where he will attend the UN General Assembly in September.
Obama and Xi are also expected to discuss Washington's concerns about what it sees as China's cyber espionage and some of the more fraught issues including China's claims over the South China Sea.

Xi wants to open up the economy to the world more.
On Tuesday, President Xi Jinping told a group charged with managing reforms that the economy had to open up more to the outside world to accelerate growth.
The president said China should improve its opening-up policies by attracting foreign investment and expertise at the 16th Central Leading Group on Financial and Economic Affairs meeting.
Xi said that making new reforms will bring new energy and vitality, and open up a new area for economic growth.

The leading group accepted a series of proposals, including a negative list regulating market access, relaxing border control policies, encouraging state-owned enterprises (SOEs) to incorporate private capital, and reviewing the registration system for residents.
According to the announcement, a negative list will be prepared to define prohibited sectors and business lines for investment.
The system will be tested step by step and developed with pilot programs.
This is a major move, since it will play a bigger role in allocating resources to the market and will make the market more transparent by providing a legal framework.
The government will also ease controls on firms to allow companies to run their own affairs.
The statement also indicates that China will study new models of border economic cooperation in the border areas and new mechanisms will come into play to encourage regional growth.
More fields will open up for private investment in order to open up sectors which are controlled by the state.
The statement said, "the government will not change its policy towards foreign investment and will better serve foreign-funded companies by protecting their interests."
In addition, the requirements for foreigners to obtain permanent residence or green card will be optimized and the application process will be streamlined.
The guarantee of the rights of lawyers to have practical experience, and the training of professional judges and prosecutors was also discussed at the meeting.
According to a statement issued after the meeting, Premier Li Keqiang and senior leaders Liu Yunshan and Zhang Gaoli also attended the meeting.

A small step for Banksy, a big step for the "global"
The world premiere of the collection "The Art of Banksy" bringing together the works of the mysterious street artist Banksy has been held in Istanbul.
The exhibition, which is the first exhibition of Global Karaköy building, is composed of 85 original pieces of art and is the product of 15 years of work.
The first exhibition of the mysterious street artist Bansky opened in Istanbul's Global Karaköy (Rıhtım Street) yesterday.
The world-famous artist, who hid his identity and used a pseudonym, was obviously not at the opening.
We also do not know if he will come to Istanbul.
But, according to the curator of the exhibition Steve Lazaridas, Banksy was not aware of the show.
There is no situation that requires his permission.
Because the street of Bansky and Lazaridas, who used to be friends, has been separated for 12 years.
Some of the works in the exhibition are from Lazaridas and some are collected from collectors.
But there are things that Banksy's followers want to know.
What would Banksy think of "The Art of Banksy" exhibition which brings together 85 of his works?
What would she think if she saw the small store created at the end of the 800 meter square gallery area? How would she react to the fact that tickets (35 TL) are required to enter the exhibition?

Would the author of works such as The Little Girl with the Red Balloon, The Cleaner, and Smile be upset to see her illustrations printed on tote bags, wallets, and pendants that raise awareness about the world's problems?
For Banksy fans, the idea that an artist with anarchist roots, who has made a point of keeping his identity secret, would be transformed into a consumer product is a disappointment.
It's not Banksy's style.
But you still should get your tickets before they are sold out!
A small show for Banksy, a big one for the globalizing world, "The Art of Banksy" can be seen until April.

TEOG Results are Announced
The results of the TEOG - the Transition System from Primary Education to Secondary Education - organized by the Ministry of National Education (MEB) have been announced.
The results of the exam which was taken on the 25-26 November were finally announced.
Weighted Common Exam Score: Weights are multiplied by the scores obtained in the subjects included in the Common Exams.
The weighted mean of course grades, which is the sum of the courses' weighted grades divided by the sum of their weights, is determined for each period.
The arithmetic average of the weighted standardized exam scores is the weighted standardized exam score.
The scoring is out of a maximum of 700 points.
The basis for placement is the sum of the year-end grades from grades 6, 7 and 8, and the weighted sum of the 8th grade end of year exam scores.
The total is divided by two, and the result is the placement score.
Scoring is done out of 500 points.

'I found 26 people while I was looking for two wrestlers'
Mete Gümürhan's second documentary, "Young Wrestlers," 66.
The first Turkish documentary selected for the "Generation L+" section of the Berlin Film Festival (February 11-21).
Born in Edirne and owning a production company in the Netherlands, Gumurhan told why and how he shot the documentary, which he completed in summer 2014.

"The Young Wrestlers", which tells the story of six boarding school students from Amasya who aim to become world champions in wrestling, will compete in the "Generation Kplus" section at the Berlin Film Festival.
The first documentary from Turkey to be selected to this section, Young Wrestlers, is one of the nominees of the Crystal Bear award.
Although born and raised in Holland, the director Mete Gümürhan is originally from Edirne.
He listened to his grandfather's stories of oil wrestling while visiting Turkey during his summer vacations as a child and watched the matches.
"There are not only political problems in Turkey."
I wanted to tell the world what else was happening in Anatolia.
He wants to make a documentary project by joining forces with six directors, because of the idea "for example, the traditional sport of wrestling is not well known".
This project turns out to be fruitless, but one day a magazine article that he reads on the plane opens the door to a new project for Gumurhan.
'We stayed in a candy factory'
Following the traces of the article that talks about two small wrestling brothers, Mete Gümürhan goes to Samsun where the family lives.
The father of the children did not allow to shoot the documentary.
Gümürhan explains how he overcame this difficulty: "I thought all day long about what I could do.
Because they could lose the support of the Ministry of Culture.
The father was talking about a boarding school in Amasya where the children would go to.
I feel like going there.
When I was looking for two children I encountered in the school 26 children who were interested in wrestling.
We started the pre-production in a week and finished the permissions.
We had no place to stay.
"We stayed in the dormitory of the sugar factory."
The biggest difficulty the director encountered in making this documentary, which was completed in three weeks, was the language.
Gümürhan says that there was three different languages spoken in the set which was attended by a foreign camera man and a sound engineer, and that she did not know what she would encounter.
"They did not know Turkish either." she says.
Young Wrestlers focuses on the stories of six of the 26 child wrestlers.

Baran, who is raised by his grandfather and has a weight problem, Harun, who cannot attend the training because he has broken his arm, Beytullah, who is ambitious but has health problems, Ümit, who is the sweetest kid of the school, Ahmet, who is the youngest champion, and Muhammed, who keeps the group together...
Mete Gümürhan describes his work with children as follows: "I let them be totally natural."
I just tried to use Mohammed everywhere.
I shot the training for first and a half weeks.
My wish was that the children would act as if there was no camera.
"Thank goodness they adapted quickly."
Berlin was chosen as a surprise

Mete Gümürhan says that he did not expect Young Wrestlers to be selected for the Berlin Film Festival, saying, "We have prepared for the event, but being selected for the Berlin Film Festival was a surprise."
Young Pehlivan is not a documentary but a movie that tells the struggles of the children and the highlights of their lives.
"I wanted to bring to the fore the stories of the kids who are struggling to find their identity and cope with their problems", he says.

But with no and's, if's, or but's: "We will not be party to this crime!"
It had supported the academicians by saying "we are with you" with the Initiative of Academicians for Peace.

The petition was signed by 1,128 academics from 89 universities and also by renowned intellectuals and theorists of worldwide fame, such as Noam Chomsky, David Harvey, Immanuel Wallerstein, Judith Butler, and Etienne Balibar.
President Erdoğan and Prime Minister Davutoğlu harshly criticized the academicians' statement as "supporting terrorism," and Erdoğan called on institutions to take action.
After this call, some universities ended their academics' jobs and the prosecutors started investigations.

I'm your fan. Please help me!
Hürrem Sultan's red hair, Beren's nose, Justin's hair...
Trying to look like celebrities is considered normal to a certain extent, but after it starts to affect the person's whole life, it is regarded as a psychological disorder.
`Celebrity worship syndrome`, also known as 'worshiping the celebrity syndrome', is a topic that has already become an academic subject in the world, but recently starting to be discussed in Turkey.
It can be considered normal to some extent for women to run to the hairdresser's with famous photos of women in their hands.
But do not forget the year of Hurrem Sultan, when all teenagers were moving around with red hair.
It is long known that “Beren's nose” (a popular Turkish TV series) took the lead in the aesthetic operations of the past year, 2015.
It's pretty much the same on the men's side.
There was a time where it was considered manly to dress like Polat Alemdar.
Now the wind is blowing on the other side.
Our environment is filled with Justin Bieber copies.

In fact, the useless piece of information that I quoted above that has been read thousands of times on the Internet: "First of all, when you go to the barber, cut the side of your hair, above the ears and around, towards the top of your head."
They will be short-lived loners.
After the cutting process, you should use water to shape your hair.
After you finish styling, spray your hair to keep it in place.
To get Justin's hair, it's essential to shape it when it's wet.

All this brings to mind the academic subject 'celebrity worship syndrome' known as 'celebrity worship syndrome', which has become a subject of academic study in the world and has recently been discussed in our country.
The fans of celebrities are regarded as a bundle of love here.
Artists brag about their fan numbers and how much they affect their fans.
Fortunately, psychology doesn't see it as that straightforward.
It is discussed that especially the teenagers should decide what to eat or drink, what to wear according to the famous people.
An excessive attachment to names that are presented as unobtainable is defined as a mental disorder.
Expert psychologist Sümeyye Demir accepts that Turkey is lagging behind in its work in this field.
But he also doesn't overlook the fact that families are becoming more aware: "One of the main issues of psychology is that people find peace within themselves and within their own identity."
Previously, filling a child's room with posters and dressing up as one of these people was something that was not taken seriously at all.
That is changing now.
The parent felt the need to intervene into the situation.
"A passion for something is a sign that something has gone wrong in the life of a young adult."
The fans who ride the emotional roller coaster
Interest in celebrities, with limits, is harmless.
Demir advises us to pay attention to signs like not wanting to get married, being jealous of one's spouse and preferring his/her clothes.
As the name suggests, we are talking about famous people.
It is considered normal to be curious about them and be interested in their lives to a certain extent.

But according to the expert psychologist, young people who are not able to control themselves are in majority: "If there is no role model in the family or society to represent virtues and good behaviors, that gap is definitely filled."
Not all of the cases turn out well.
"The child copies the negativity as well."
Consulting with them on how to approach the subject, Sümeyye Demir begins by reminding us that celebrity worship syndrome is more common during adolescence.
If we consider that adolescents can be self-confident, the problem can be overcome easier.

On the one hand, we are confronted with young people who complain of the restrictions of their families while, on the other hand, they expect support and affection: "We are forced to take into account their emotional ups and downs."
New research shows that they have trouble because of changes in their brains.
"Liking and developing affection for someone in this emotional speed train is also natural, it should be accepted and approached softly."
It is possible to change one's behavior.
The psychologist Sümeyye Demir, reminds us of the duties of the parents to get past the adulation of celebrities:
Recognize her emotional struggle, be sure that you are calm before you get into the matter.
Never allow him to suppress his feelings.
Express your reverence for his admiration of independence.
Instead of scolding them, show them good examples and talk about the role models.
Let us try to examine the place of celebrities in our everyday life together.
Reading books together that tell the real world of celebrities will work.
Be sure you convert your communication to adult-to-adult form.
Do not forget that both motivation and addiction use the same pathways in the brain.
Share with your child that mistakes are opportunities for change and accept him for who he is.
Make sure to find an expert to help you with your fanning.
Irritated and envious, they also feel admiration.
The basis for the worship of the famous syndrome is the need for help and assistance from others.
An unstoppable love is actually a cry for help.
But unfortunately this is not perceived this way.
Besides, this problem is so widespread that it is not possible to limit it to any country or continent.
Dr. Recai Yahyaoğlu points out that there are certain names that are all over the television in every country.
The syndrome is more connected with the attachment to these celebrities: "They are extraordinary."
The general majority does not have their means.
Those who have it do not behave like them.
Either they did not adopt them, or they did not dare to.
"But those who cannot afford to live that way, and those who can afford it but cannot live that way, continue to watch with irritation."
Whether you are watching this with envy or with anger, it makes no difference.
Both of them secretly nurture admiration.
They earn easy money, they are in the spotlight of the magazine.
This knowledge alone is enough to increase the fandom.
Another advice from expert psychologist Sümeyye Demir is that they should question the reality of those lives at this point.
The artificial lives should not be neglected.
Support by the surroundings, who are enamoured by the celebrity, comes into play.
But the person does not want to admit that the celebrity whom he is a fan of also has problems like himself.

Do I need to have a gallbladder surgery? - Family - Health News - Zaman Newspaper
Dr. Fevzi Özgönül answers questions in his column in Meydan newspaper.
I have gallstones in my gallbladder, and every morning when I get up, I go to the toilet 2 or more times a day with stomach ache after eating.
Could this be what is keeping me from losing weight?
I've been using alkaline for some time, but I can't lose weight.
It's been like that since my childhood.
What should I do?
Do you think I should have a gall bladder operation?
ANSWER: Most of the time, the bile duct stone is accompanied by an infection.
This distress after eating is also a sign that when you eat, the gallbladder constricts and releases bile into the intestines.
Intestinal tracts which are disturbed by inflammatory bile try to get rid of this bile quickly.
That's why you go to the toilet so often.
And because you're going to the bathroom so often, your food is not being digested and you are losing weight slowly.
I think you need to get that treated.
If you visit a gastroenterologist, and if the situation that I say is detected, you can get rid of this situation by using antibiotics.
However, you may eventually have to have your gall bladder removed.
An alkaline probiotic may help reduce some of these complaints, but do not pass them.
I would advise everyone to continue to use alkaline probiotic drinks.
Because the biggest help in losing weight is this probiotic powder.
I eat too much when I am stressed out.
When I am stressed and annoyed, I indulge myself in food and gain weight.
How can I cope with this?
ANSWER: Excessive food cravings actually mean that the need for energy is not being met.
This might be because they eat less, skipping breakfast and lunch.
Another reason is that you do not digest the food you eat.
For this your digestive system has to work in a healthy way.
If you don't have ulcer, reflux or similar problems, the easiest way is to use a good probiotic medicine.
You will benefit a lot from this.
I can't gain weight, doctors don't know the reason
You usually have information about losing weight in your column.
It seems all very logical to me but my situation is a little different.

I just can't put on any weight.
"""
Most importantly, I don't know why.
The doctors say nothing.
The techniques we apply are not only directed at losing weight but also at regaining the physiological functioning of the body and bringing it back to its ideal measurements.
Obesity and weakness are both kinds of illness.
Obesity and underweight are treated with the same technique.
You also get thinner when you eat sweets and pastries.
I think you have understood that so far.
It is possible for you to be stimulated with carboxypuncture and gain weight with a healthy diet.
So you have been moving away from your ideal weight.
The rest of the patients have also distanced themselves from their ideal bodies by fattening.
You will reach your ideal body by gaining weight, they will reach theirs by losing weight.
If the systemic problems are solved, you will gain weight, and they will lose it.
However, the system needs to work properly first.

A child who feels worthless is "embroiled in hatred"
Some human emotions are innate.
Fear, sadness, joy, astonishment, anger, concern...
However, hate and revenge like emotions appear in children over time and as a result of some faulty attitudes.
Every human being needs to be an individual, including in their childhood.
In other words, he/she would like his/her parent or social environment to respect his/her decisions and discuss his/her opinions on issues concerning him/her, and also feel that he/she is valuable.

Ensuring these are in place forms the basis of a healthy personality structure.
'''

For example, making decisions on behalf of the child (what to wear, what to eat) on issues that concern the child, not paying attention to the child's wishes and imposing one's own truths (the child who wants to go to a soccer course is sent to an instrumental course) are behaviors that mean disrespect for the child's personality.

The child who is not respected in his/her individuality and existence loses his/her freedom of 'being oneself', and the defense mechanism brings the feeling of anger and hate to the forefront in order to protect him/her.

Psychologist Hilal Arslan says that "Because, in fact, rage and hate are the exact opposite of acceptance." She says that by hating, the child is not accepting what is being done to him, and he is trying to tell both himself and his environment that he is valuable.

The expert says that the child's reaction to this situation is a positive development for his personality. S/he says that what the child expresses here is 'I am here, too,' and this serves the purpose of preserving his respect for himself.
He says, "If children are allowed to be individuals, hatred will disappear."
The child tries to protect her own identity by taking refuge in anger and hate.

Arslan says that when the parents and surroundings of children abuse them, verbally or emotionally, in their most vulnerable physical and psychological times, the children will experience negative feelings, and he says that neglecting the children will make them feel invisible and that they are not appreciated.

Arslan continues his speech as follows: "This can be in the form of not meeting both their emotional needs (not hugging them, not kissing them, not caring about their school or other needs), and their physical needs (not feeding them, not giving them a place to stay, not caring about their school needs, etc.)."
This is a child-rearing practice that opens the door to anger and hatred.
As for emotional and verbal abuse, there are behaviors such as humiliation, name-calling, belittling, scolding, excessive and harsh punishment, making one feel worthless, and shouting.
Given that this behavior is targeted at the child's personality, it is deeply troubling.

"Either the child gives up and loses respect for himself, and spends his life struggling with feelings of worthlessness, not being good enough and unloved, or he develops anger and resentment to try and protect his self-worth."

118 illegal immigrants from Syria and Pakistan, who embarked on a journey of hope with a boat and a fishing boat from Bodrum, were rescued by Turkish and Greek Coast Guard teams.

A group of 105 Syrian migrants, which included women and children, experienced a difficult time when their 15-meter-long fishing boat, which they boarded from the Küdür Site of Yalıkavak Neighborhood, hit the Kargı Island rocks, as they were trying to reach the Greek island of Kalimnos (Kalimnos Island).
The Turkish coast guard, with the assistance of fishermen, rescued the Syrians who were trapped in a boat that was stranded on the rocks.
105 illegal immigrants were brought to Yalıkavak Port.

The rubber boat carrying 13 illegal immigrants with Pakistani and Syrian citizenship tried to cross to the Greek Island of Halki (Kos) from Turgutreis with a 5-meter rubber boat, but it drifted to the waters near the Island of Psemiros due to the storm and current.
The Greek Coast Guard teams, that were on a patrol duty at 07:00, noticed the people on the boat who were passing the danger of sinking by taking in water.
Some of the refugees who fell into the sea were rescued and taken to the island of Kilimli.
At least 20 dead, 15 injured - World News - Zaman Newspaper
At least 20 people died and 15 were wounded in a bomb and gun attack on a hotel popular with foreigners in the capital of the West African country of Burkina Faso, Ouagadougou.
The attack was claimed by a local Moroccan group affiliated with Al Qaeda.
Militants are reported to have taken some hostages inside the 147-room Splendid Hotel.
The operation by security forces on the hotel, which started five hours after the attack, is ongoing.
There are explosions and loud gunfire coming from the building which no one can approach.
The partial fire which broke out at the hotel due to the explosives is still continuing.
How many people are held hostage inside is not known yet.
It was learned that the hotel was particularly preferred by foreigners and United Nations (UN) officials.

Robert Sangare, administrator of the Yalgado Ouedraogo hospital, recorded that 20 people died during the siege, 15 people were seriously injured by bullets, and they were concerned that the number of deaths would increase.
The interim president was briefly detained in last September's coup attempt in Burkina Faso.
Burkina Faso Prime Minister Paul Kaba Thieba announced his new cabinet three days ago and President Roch Marc Christian Kabore took on the Defense Ministry as well.
Romania goes for transparency in election spending
In Romania, a new draft law is being prepared that provides for the exact determination of the origin of the funds used in elections and for a upper limit on spending.

The government wants contributions to political parties by individuals and companies who sponsor politicians to be made more transparent, as part of a package of measures to be introduced before the next election.
The draft law envisages the prevention of "decision money" used in elections.
The bill requires that each party or individual spending money on election propaganda do so through an account at a bank.
With this way all the money spent will be controllable in a more transparent and regulated way by the Romanian Court of Accounts (AEP).
In addition, a ceiling is being planned on expenditures in the draft.
Keywords: Romania, elections spending, transparency, Bucharest
